alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 8:47PM MST until June 29 at 11:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 1145 PM MST. * At 845 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Crown King area. This region has already experienced several rounds of heavy rain earlier this evening. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crown King, Castle Hot Springs, Turney Gulch Group Campground and Hazlett Hollow Campground. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Poland Creek, Willow Creek, Sycamore Creek, Jim Creek, Tiger Creek, Humbug Creek, Ash Creek, Blind Indian Creek, Tuscumbia Creek, East Fork Castle Creek, Bear Creek, North Fork Cellar Springs Creek, Black Canyon, Boulder Creek, Crazy Basin Creek, Oak Creek, Tussock Spring Creek, Cherry Creek, Castle Creek, French Creek, Towers Creek, Sand Creek, Banty Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Minnehaha Creek and Cellar Springs Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
